Description: Wooden anthropoid shabti-coffin with a lappet-wig and an unmodelled face; the lid is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphic text(very faded); inside is a wooden shabti with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard and crossed arms; nine rows of Hieroglyphic text on the leg section; traces of white paint.
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
